metadata.title: USN-3942-1 -- OpenJDK 7 vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that a memory disclosure issue existed in the OpenJDK Library subsystem. An attacker could use this to expose sensitive information and possibly bypass Java sandbox restrictions.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3942-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  openjdk-7-jre-zero - 7u211-2.6.17-0ubuntu0.1 openjdk-7-source - 7u211-2.6.17-0ubuntu0.1 icedtea-7-jre-jamvm - 7u211-2.6.17-0ubuntu0.1 openjdk-7-tests - 7u211-2.6.17-0ubuntu0.1 openjdk-7-jre-lib - 7u211-2.6.17-0ubuntu0.1 openjdk-7-jdk - 7u211-2.6.17-0ubuntu0.1 openjdk-7-jre-headless - 7u211-2.6.17-0ubuntu0.1 openjdk-7-jre - 7u211-2.6.17-0ubuntu0.1 openjdk-7-doc - 7u211-2.6.17-0ubuntu0.1 openjdk-7-demo - 7u211-2.6.17-0ubuntu0.1 No subscription required
